translator.minionExpressionTranslator
Class SpecialExpressionTranslator

java.lang.Object
  translator.minionExpressionTranslator.AtomExpressionTranslator
      translator.minionExpressionTranslator.MulopExpressionTranslator
          translator.minionExpressionTranslator.RelationalExpressionTranslator
              translator.minionExpressionTranslator.SpecialExpressionTranslator
All Implemented Interfaces:
MinionTranslatorGlobals
Direct Known Subclasses:
QuantifiedMulopExpressionTranslator
public class SpecialExpressionTranslator
extends RelationalExpressionTranslator

Translates top-level binary expressions into rather smart Minion constraints: it can translate scalar products (simple sums and weighted sums), partwise scalar products and simple binary expressions that consist of at least one atom.

Author:
andrea
See Also:
BinaryExpression

translateSpecialExpression

protected MinionConstraint translateSpecialExpression(Expression e,
                                                      boolean willBeReified)
                                               throws TranslationUnsupportedException,
                                                      MinionException,
                                                      ClassNotFoundException,
                                                      PreprocessorException
Translates top-level binary expressions into rather smart Minion constraints: it can translate scalar products (simple sums and weighted sums), partwise scalar products and simple binary expressions that consist of at least one atom.

Parameters:
e - a Expression being a binary Expression that is translated rather sophisticatedly
willBeReified - states if the translated expression has to be reifiable
Returns:
TODO
Throws:
TranslationUnsupportedException
MinionException
ClassNotFoundException
PreprocessorException

reifyConstraint

protected MinionBoolVariable reifyConstraint(MinionReifiableConstraint constraint)
                                      throws MinionException
Handles reification If we have to reify a sum, then we need 2 variables to reify it because we only have sumgeq and sumleq in Minion.

Parameters:
constraint -
Returns:
Throws:
MinionException

removeAtomicSubExpressions

protected Expression removeAtomicSubExpressions(Expression e)
Removes the atomic subexpression "true" in conjunctions. Consider for instance that the expression "a \/ true" can be evaluated to "a".

Parameters:
e - the Expression whose atomic subexpressions are removed
Returns:
Expression e without subexpressions "true"
Throws:
PreprocessorException

translateIteratedArithmeticExpression

protected MinionConstraint translateIteratedArithmeticExpression(BinaryExpression be,
                                                                 boolean willBeReified)
                                                          throws TranslationUnsupportedException,
                                                                 MinionException,
                                                                 PreprocessorException,
                                                                 ClassNotFoundException
Translate an expression where its expression tree or both branches of the tree can be mapped top a weithed sum constraint. This method can only be evoked, if the expression is sure to have a mappable structure!! * compute the values of the leaf (or multiplication-subtree) of the expression structure and store the corresponding values.
Example: (we know that "Right" must contain either an atom like "x" or a factorised variable like 2*x)

upperTree
/ \
Left Right

Parameters:
be -
willBeReified -
Returns:
Throws:
TranslationUnsupportedException
MinionException
PreprocessorException
ClassNotFoundException
